title.title: Please provide your proposal title
title.description:
**Proposal title**

Please note we suggest you use no more than 60 characters for your proposal title so that it can be easily viewed in the voting app.
title.x-guidance: This is the first detail about your proposal that voters see so it should clearly express what the proposal is about. A clear, unambiguous, and concise title is very important.
title.x-placeholder: Summarize your proposal in 60 characters or less

applicant.title: Lead participant name and surname
applicant.description: Name and surname of main applicant
applicant.x-guidance: The lead project participant is considered as the individual responsible for the proposed project and the person authorized to act on behalf of other applicants (where applicable).

type.title: Are you delivering this project as an individual or as an entity (whether formally incorporated or not)?
type.description: Are you delivering this project as an individual or as an entity (whether formally incorporated or not)
type.x-guidance:
Please select from one of the following:

1. Individual
2. Entity (Incorporated)
3. Entity (Not Incorporated)

coproposers.title: Co-proposers and additional applicants
coproposers.x-guidance:
List any person who is submitting the proposal jointly with the lead applicant.

By listing additional persons, you confirm these individuals approve of being jointly responsible for the project and proposal.

**IMPORTANT - A maximum of 6 (six) proposals can be led or co-proposed by the same applicant or enterprise per fund. Please, reference [Fund14 rules](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/fund-rules) for added detail**

name.title: Enter the names of co-proposers or additional applicants

requestedFunds.title: Enter the amount of funding you are requesting in ADA
requestedFunds.description: The amount of funding requested for your proposal
requestedFunds.x-guidance:
Each funding category has a minimum and maximum amount of funding a single proposal can request.

Minimum Funding Amount per proposal:

- Cardano Use Cases: Partners & Products: **₳250k**
- Cardano Uses Cases: Concepts: **₳15K**
- Cardano Open: Developers: **₳15K**
- Cardano Open: Ecosystem: **₳15K**

Maximum Funding Amount per proposal:

- Cardano Use Cases: Partners & Products: **₳1M**
- Cardano Uses Cases: Concepts: **₳100K**
- Cardano Open: Developers: **₳100K**
- Cardano Open: Ecosystem: **₳60K**
requestedFunds.x-placeholder: Enter the amount of funding you are requesting in ADA

duration.title: Please specify how many months you expect your project to last
duration.description: Specify the expected duration of your project. Projects must be completable within 2-12 months.
duration.x-guidance:
You are expected to produce the deliverables specified in the proposal within the timeframe selected, with a minimum of 2 months and a maximum of 12 months.

Projects can be completed earlier if milestone Proof-of-Achievements and Project Completion steps are submitted and approved ahead of the expected delivery due dates.

If you wish, you can link a document with the proposal in your native language. 

Tick “NO” if your proposal has not been automatically translated into English from another language.

problem.title: Problem Statement
problem.description: Define the problem your proposal aims to solve

statement.title: What is the problem you want to solve?
statement.description: Clearly define the problem you aim to solve. This will be visible in the Catalyst voting app.
statement.x-guidance:
Ensure you present a well-defined problem. What is the core issue that you hope to fix? Remember: the reader might not recognize the problem unless you state it clearly.

This answer will be displayed on the Catalyst voting app, so voters will see it even if they do not open your proposal to read it in detail.
statement.x-placeholder: Describe the problem to be solved with your proposed project

solution.title: Solution Overview
solution.description: Describe your proposed solution to the problem

summary.title: Summarize your solution to the problem
summary.description: Briefly describe your solution. Focus on what you will do or create to solve the problem.
summary.x-guidance:
Focus on what you are going to do, or change to solve the problem. Avoid “There should be a way to...” and ensure “We will build a...!”.

Clearly state how the solution addresses the problem you have identified. Make sure you connect the 'why' and the 'how' of your solution.

This answer will be displayed on the Catalyst voting app, so voters will see it even if they do not open your proposal and read it in detail.
summary.x-placeholder: Describe how you will solve the problem

supportingLinks.title: Supporting Documentation
supportingLinks.description: Additional resources and documentation for your proposal
supportingLinks.x-guidance:
Here, provide links to your or your partner’s organization’s website, repository, or marketing materials. Alternatively, provide links to any whitepaper or publication relevant to your proposal.

Note that this is additional information that voters and Community Reviewers might choose not to read. Attaching files does not mean you do not need to answer the questions in this form.
supportingLinks.x-placeholder: Enter relevant links (website, GitHub, whitepaper, etc.)

dependencies.description: External dependencies and requirements for project success

hasDependency.title: Does your project have any dependencies on other organizations, technical or otherwise?
hasDependency.description: Does your project have any dependencies on other organizations, technical or otherwise?
hasDependency.x-guidance:
List dependencies and prerequisites for your project’s success. These are usually external factors (such as third-party suppliers, external resources, third-party software, etc.) that may cause a delay or represent a risk due to less control over resources.

In the case of third-party software, indicate whether you have the necessary licenses and permission to use such software.
hasDependency.x-placeholder: Select if your project has any dependencies

dependencyDetail.title: Describe any dependencies or write 'No dependencies'
dependencyDetail.description: Here you should list any dependencies and prerequisites for your project's success. These are usually external factors (such as third-party suppliers, external resources, third-party software, etc.) that may cause a delay, since a project has less control over them. In case of third party software, indicate whether you have the necessary licenses and permission to use such software.
dependencyDetail.x-guidance: If “YES”, please describe the dependencies and why you believe them essential to the project's delivery. If “NO”, please write "No dependencies"

open_source.title: Project Open Source
open_source.description: Will your project's output be fully open source? Open source refers to something people can modify and share because its design is publicly accessible.

isOpenSource.title: Will your project's outputs be fully open source?
isOpenSource.description: Select Yes if the project is open source, No if it is not.
isOpenSource.x-guidance:
If you answered “YES” to the question above:

If you declare that the project will be open-source in the application form, it must remain open-source throughout the entire lifecycle of the project, with a publicly accessible repository.

Please indicate the type of open-source license you intend to use and provide any additional information relevant to the open-source status of your project outputs. If only specific components of the code will be open-source, please specify which parts.

If you answered “NO” to the question above:

Please explain why the outputs of your project will not be made open-source.

licenseInformation.title: License and Additional Information
licenseInformation.description: Provide the license type and any additional context regarding the open-source status of your project. If partially open source, specify which parts are open source.
licenseInformation.x-placeholder: Describe the open source status of your project and the license type
licenseInformation.x-guidance:
Open-source software is software whose source code is publicly accessible and licensed in a way that allows anyone to use, modify, and share it freely, typically under licenses approved by the Open Source Initiative.

Proprietary software source code is not publicly available and the rights to use, modify, or redistribute proprietary software are restricted and typically reserved by the software's owner.

https://opensource.org/licenses

campaign_category.title: Campaign Category
campaign_category.description: Determine the eligibility of the proposal for this category

category_questions.title: Category Questions
category_questions.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.
category_questions.x-guidance:
General Guidance

In consideration of the Reviewers assessing your proposal, be concise and use bulleted lists where possible.

established_partnership.title: Describe your established partnerships.
established_partnership.description: Please provide your rationale for your established partnerships.
established_partnership.x-guidance:
- For instance, agreements, letters of intent, or public endorsements.
- If confidential, contact the Catalyst team.
- Clearly state the partners and describe their role in your project.

funding_commitments.title: Describe matching funding commitments and/or partners.
funding_commitments.description: Please provide your rationale for your funding commitments and/or matching partners.
funding_commitments.x-guidance:
- For instance, financial or in-kind contributions (time, resources, services).
- Clearly state contributors, the kind of contribution, the amount,  and how it will be managed.
- Avoid general claims without named partners.

performance_metrics.title: Describe your key performance metrics.
performance_metrics.description: Please provide your rationale for your key performance metrics.
performance_metrics.x-guidance:
- For instance, data (user numbers, transactions, traffic, adoption rates), screenshots of dashboards or live analytics.
- Contextualize why your KPIs matter for your project goals.

theme.title: Theme
theme.description: Long-term vision and categorization of your project

grouped_tag.title: Please choose the most relevant category group and tag related to the outcomes of your proposal.

solution.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
solution.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
solution.x-guidance:
How you write this section will depend on what type of proposal you are writing. You might want to include details on:

- How do you perceive the problem you are solving?
- What are your reasons for approaching it in the way that you have?
- Who will your project engage?
- How will you demonstrate or prove your impact?

Explain what is unique about your solution, who will benefit, and why this is important to Cardano.

impact.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
impact.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
impact.x-guidance:
Please include here a description of how you intend to measure impact (whether quantitative or qualitative) and how and with whom you will share your outputs:

- In what way will the success of your project bring value to the Cardano Community?
- How will you measure this impact?
- How will you share the outputs and opportunities that result from your project?

feasibility.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
feasibility.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
feasibility.x-guidance:
Please describe your existing capabilities that demonstrate how and why you believe you’re best suited to deliver this project?
Please include the steps or processes that demonstrate that you can be trusted to manage funds properly.

milestones.title: Project Milestones
milestones.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
milestones.x-guidance: Please note milestones are only indicative during the proposal submission stage. Each funded project will formalize a milestone schedule and amounts during the onboarding stage.

milestone_list.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
milestone_list.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details
milestone_list.x-guidance:
- For Grant Amounts of up to 75k ada, at least 2 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**3 milestones in total**)
- For Grant Amounts over 75k ada up to 150k ada, at least 3 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**4 milestones in total**)
- For Grant Amounts over 150k ada up to 300k ada, at least 4 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**5 milestones in total**)
- For Grant Amounts exceeding 300k ada, at least 5 milestones, plus the final one including Project Close-out Report and Video, must be included (**6 milestones in total**)

Please follow this [guideline here](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/project-onboarding/milestone-based-proposals) to understand how to build your indicative milestones. Each milestone must have declared:

who.title: Who is in the project team and what are their roles?
who.description: Who is in the project team and what are their roles?
who.x-guidance:
List your team, their Linkedin profiles (or similar) and state what aspect of the proposal  each team member will undertake.

If additional team members need to be recruited, please state what skills gaps you are looking to fill so readers understand what other roles will be needed to complete the project.

You are expected to have already engaged the relevant members of the organizations referenced so you have their commitment and capacity to support the project. If you have not taken any steps to this effect, it is likely that the resources will not be available if you are approved for funding, which can jeopardize the project before it has even begun.

Your proposal will be publicly available, so make sure to obtain any consent required before including confidential or third party information.

All Project Participants must disclose their role and scope of services across any submitted proposals, even if they are not in the lead or co-proposer role, such as an implementer, vendor, service provider.. Failure to disclose this information may lead to disqualification from the current fund round.

costs.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
costs.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
costs.x-guidance:
Make sure every item of work is budgeted. It may be helpful to refer to your plan and timeline, list the resources you will need at each stage, and what they cost.

Provide a clear description of any third party product or service you will be using: hardware, software licenses, professional services (e.g. legal, accounting, code auditing).

If the cost of the project will exceed the funding request, please provide information about how you will cover the shortfall of funding.

Most proposers forget to budget for: publicity,  marketing,  promotion, community engagement, project management, documentation, and reporting back to the community.

It is your team’s responsibility to properly manage the funds provided. Make sure to reference [Fund Rules](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/fund-rules) to understand eligibility around costs.

note.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for money for the Cardano ecosystem?
note.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for money for the Cardano ecosystem?
note.x-guidance:
Provide a compelling reason about how your project represents a good use of funds and justify how it will create value for the Cardano ecosystem.

Provide context or justification about the costs you listed and why you need them.

For instance, can you reason with supporting evidence that costs are proportional to the average wage in your country, or typical freelance rates in your industry? Is there anything else that helps to support how the project represents value for money?
